sentences.text: Presidential elections are due to be held in Cameroon on 5 October 2025.

The 2018 Cameroonian presidential election|previous presidential elections on 7 October 2018 saw incumbent president Paul Biya elected for another seven-year term following a 2008 constitutional amendment that removed term limits, allowing Biya to run again.

references.text: <ref>[http://www.france24.com/en/20080411-cameroon-parliament-paul-biya-term-limit-extension Cameroon parliament extends Biya's term limit] France 24, 11 April 2008</ref>

sentences.text: The President of Cameroon is elected by first-past-the-post voting; the candidate with the most votes is declared the winner with no requirement to achieve a majority. Registration for voting ended on 31 August 2024, with more than seven million people estimated to have signed up.

references.text: <ref name="29dec">{{Cite news |date=31 August 2024 |title=Voter registration ends in Cameroon as polls near |language=en |work=Africanews |url=https://www.africanews.com/2024/08/31/voter-registration-ends-in-cameroon-as-polls-near/ |access-date=1 September 2024}}</ref>

sentences.text:
* '''Paul Biya''', aged 92, incumbent president and candidate for the Cameroon People's Democratic Movement.
* '''Maurice Kamto''', aged 71, is a retired academic and lawyer, representing the Cameroon Renaissance Movement (MRC). Kamto, who previously ran in the 2018 Cameroonian presidential election|2018 presidential election, is also supported by the Political Alliance for Reform (APC) and the Front for Change in Cameroon (FCC).
* '''Akere Muna''', aged 72, is an international Cameroonian lawyer and candidate for the Univers party. Akere is globally renowned especially in the areas of anti-corruption and good governance and previously a candidate for Now!.
* '''Eric Essono Tsimi''', aged 43, is an academic based in New York and a writer. He announced his "civil and civic" candidacy in May 2024 during an interview with journalist Jean-Bruno Tagne on Naja TV. His campaign is being carried out under the platform ''Nous Sommes Le Changement / We Are the Change''. Tsimi has also been engaged in negotiations with various political parties, including the FDC and the PAL.
